EFL On the rak Barcelona leave Ivan Rakitic out of matchday squad as rumours he could leave Nou Camp for Manchester United intensify 
Croat omitted for 'technical reasons' despite being fit and available — has been in and out of team in recent weeks By ANDREW RICHARDSON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LUIS ENRIQUE left Ivan Rakitic out of his matchday squad for ‘technical reasons’ — adding fuel to speculation he could be set to leave the Nou Camp. 
Barcelona currently trail Real Madrid by a staggering NINE points and must win at Villarreal to keep their title dream alive. Getty Images Ivan Rakitic has been left out of matchday squad by Barcelona to face Villarreal 
However, they will be doing so without Rakitic , despite the Croatian being fit and available. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Barcelona news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
The news will surely alert Juventus , who are in the market for a playmaker, while Paris Saint-Germain are also sniffing around — and AC Milan and Inter need that big-name player to show their ambitions. 
Manchester United are also planning an audacious bid for the midfielder . 
Rakitic, 28, moved from Sevilla in 2014 as a long-term replacement for Xavi . 
And he proved an inspirational purchase as Barcelona dazzled their way to a Treble of La Liga , Copa del Rey and Champions League — with Rakitic opening the scoring in the final against Juventus. 
However, he has been in and out of the team in recent weeks. Summer signings Andre Gomes and Denis Suarez have often been included at the Croatian’s expense and Rakitic hasn’t featured in La Liga since being replaced midway through the 1-1 draw in El Clasico . 
Barcelona travel to El Madrigal for the first time since a 2-2 draw threatened to unravel a season which had promised so much. 
They were 2-0 up and set to go 11 points clear at the top of La Liga, before the hosts turned the match on its head to grab a point. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog Getty Images 6 Barcelona’s season threatened to fall apart after last visit to El Madrigal 
Barca then lost their next three matches, as Atletico Madrid drew level at the summit, and Real Madrid moved to within a point. 
While Diego Simeone ’s men also knocked the Catalans out of the Champions League during a dismal run.
